description: I tried QownNotes before this, seeing that it was well reviewed. It's integration with being saved to the cloud, it's creation of a folder, and changing and moving around my files led me to instantly remove it. I want *just* a markdown editor with a preview panel. And this is exactly that. That's all it is and that's all it needs to be.
Very useful for editing markdown documents.

A perfect distraction free editor. Install pandoc and latex with this and you just have an amazing editor for your papers, novels, docs, etc... 

Just one thing missing: more flexibility on the "output". It would be great to be able to choose from the "export" window a (e.g.) latex template for the document. At the moment you can have a YaML header, but it is not perfect.

I've been using Ghostwriter as my exclusive Markdown editor for several years. The best thing I can say about it is that I've never been tempted to look at another Markdown editor since. Ghostwriter perfectly meets my needs and has worked flawlessly with every distro I've used.

Ghostwriter is a truly wonderful text editor. I have used it for a few years now, and find it the best writing software, which gets out of the way and allows me to work without getting distracted. It's well worth downloading. I would be very lost without it.
Closed unexpectedly and lost all my work(
The app has great functionality and it is one of the most fun ways of writing. It is currently on active development and is already great.
why does the app size say 1.3 GBs for download if its minimal ?????

Ghostwriter is great, particularly for working with local files. I've found it gets into a frustrating fail state working on cloud docs. The app freezes, and is unkillable if I try to open / edit a cloud hosted .md file (on Nextcloud)
summary: I Like The App, Except for working with Nextcloud Docs
